faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes. European Union citizens and most international buyers enjoy equal property purchase rights in Spain with no restrictions on foreign ownership. Non-EU buyers may purchase property without limitations, though certain regions restrict agricultural land acquisition. The process requires Spanish tax identification number (NIE), typically obtained through your notary or legal representative. Professional legal guidance ensures compliance with Spanish property law and optimizes tax positioning.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically represent 10-12% of property value, including: Property Transfer Tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registry fees (0.5-1%), and optional legal representation (0.5-1.5%). Using this property as example: €589,900 purchase price incurs approximately €59,000-€70,000 in closing costs, bringing total investment to €649,000-€660,000. Additional considerations include annual property taxes (0.4-1.1% of cadastral value) and community fees if applicable (€100-€300 monthly in gated communities).

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca features Mediterranean climate with 300+ sunshine days annually, mild winters (average 10-15°C), and warm summers (average 25-28°C). This climate supports continuous gardening, beach access, and outdoor entertaining—fundamental to Mediterranean lifestyle appeal.
